Node.definition: = action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= process by which humans on a spiritual journey find God
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

Node.gloss: to trouble|to vex|to provoke to anger
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= block made of clay in a mold and either dried in the sun or hardened in an oven; ► used as a building material, especially in places where stone or wood was scarce
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= hairy mammal with hoofs, brown or gray in color; non ruminant and omnivorous; ◄ |iSus scropus|i*, wild or domesticated land animal; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ regarded as an ugly, filthy, and destructive animal and often associated with pagan rituals

= meat which is considered unclean, ◄ because more than two days have passed after it was sacrificed, or because it was sacrificed to idols, or because it has been prepared in an inappropriate way; ► not to be eaten
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to stay close (to oneself)

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference

Node.gloss: to be holy|to become holy|to make consecrated
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals|= causative action by which humans transfer a state of holiness to other humans by contact
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= state in which a fire (אֵשׁ) is burning up the combustible materials fueling it; ≈ associated with anger
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
literally: to pay back to (someone's) bosom; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to receive the appropriate return for their evil actions, which are mostly evil
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= indirect male progenitor
= state in which multiple events are connected

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
literally: to measure out on (someone's) lap; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to receive the appropriate return for their evil actions, which are mostly evil
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
literally: to measure out on (someone's) lap; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to receive the appropriate return for their evil actions, which are mostly evil

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness
= group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to bring out (from the womb); hence: = causative process by which deities cause children to be born

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= valley; ◄ near Jericho (יְרִחֹו) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► place where Achan (עָכָן) and his family were buried

= valley; ◄ located on northern border of territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► place where Achan (עָכָן) who caused trouble for Israel was stoned and buried; ≈ therefore associated with trouble and punishment
= place where animals lie down to rest

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= an unpredictable and uncontrollable force that shapes events favorably; ≈ it may have religious connotations, in that the force is attributed to a god of good fortune

literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= wine (יַיִן) mixed with water or spices; ► used as beverage, but also as sacrifice

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= causative action by which humans kill other humans like an animal, with a sharp bladed instrument; ≈ associated with anger, power, callousness (of the killer), and helplessness (of the victim)
= action by which humans or animals bend their knees, in order to lay down, give birth, have sex, or to be killed
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: goodness of heart; hence: = state in which humans are in high spirits
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which humans experience grief
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
literally: swearing (by someone); hence: = action by which humans mention someone's name in a curse
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans consider themselves favored by a deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which humans consider themselves favored by a deity
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which a deity is considered worthy of trust, because he is truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in his actions
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which a deity is considered worthy of trust, because he is truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in his actions
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
literally: to come up in (one's) heart or spirit; hence: = process by which humans or deities start processing something in their minds
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes|= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans continue with a certain activity until a certain amount of time fully elapses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans and animals have a certain age, ◄ referred to as a child of a certain number of years
= state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which a human being is unable to succeed in what s/he intend to do
= state in which humans and animals have a certain age, ◄ referred to as a child of a certain number of years
= state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= produce from crop bearing trees and plants
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to cause to waste away|to use up
Node.definition: = action by which someone causes objects to gradually lose their quality and strength
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
literally: empty; hence: = state in which an event does not serve a useful purpose and is bound to fail
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring
= state in which humans experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
= group of people that consider themselves descendants of one single ancestor

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= wild, four footed, predatory canine; light brown fur, similar to jackal, but much bigger; ◄ Canis lupus; ► commonly prey on flocks; ≈ regarded as ravenous and fierce; symbol of roaming, opportunistic, dangerous, fierce, and clever banditry
= young sheep, perhaps unweaned; ≈ fully dependent on its mother for nourishment and on the shepherd for protection
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= dried stalks of grain and grasses, usually left over from harvesting grain ► used as food for animals or as an ingredient for making clay bricks; ≈ associated with something of little value

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

Node.gloss: to do harm (to someone)|to make suffer|to deal, treat harshly|to afflict
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities bring suffering or disaster upon a humans, often as the result of wrong behavior
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
